class_notes: (This course begins the second sequence of three courses in Italian Studies, which culminate in an Italian language minor. During the semester Students will acquire an intermediate language level proficiency in Italian through a variety of tasks practicing speaking, writing, listening and reading in cultural context. Assessment: Grading is based on active class participation, homework, regular exams, and oral and written exams. Required Texts: New Italian Espresso Intermediate / Advanced. Alma Edizione. 9788861825710)
course_description: Utilizing authentic texts, this engaging content-based approach to language learning focuses on a historically sequenced in-depth study of Italian art, history, and literature, developing analytical-critical skills, cross-cultural competency and higher than norm linguistic fluency.
sections: Class Nbr: 3024, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: S. Muratore, Status: Open
